titleStmt.title: An elegy on the death of Sir William Turner, Knight, and alderman of the city of London, and president of Bridwell and Bethlem Hospitals, who departed this life on Thursday, the 9th. of February, about eleven of the clock in the forenoon, 1692/3.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for George Croom, at the Blew-Ball in Thames-street, over against Baynard's-Castle.,

notesStmt.note: Verse: "Come, come, prepare to weep, our sorrow's great,".
Within mourning border, with emblems and motto.
Year of publication from Wing CD-ROM, 1996.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.

place.placeName: the Blew-Ball in Thames-street, over against Baynard's-Castle.
